170363426.review: Bought this game a very long time ago, played the crap out of it. Went back into it on and off for years, just recently started up again. Man this game is fun and stressful as hell, but for what it is I enjoy this game immensely. Mind you this is with no mods or anything too change from the game's out of the box experience. What I will say this game has so much to do and if you want to look like a crazed hobo in a raincoat, mining pants, wizard hat & a summoned attacking finch with bird nest on your head you can. As i've become a lot older more single player games that I can get lost in things and have fun at my pace is more valuable over anything multiplayer. I would highly recommend this game to anyone.

"Let's play For The Worthy" they said, "It'll be fun" they said,

171447519.review: I love this game. It's fun to play alone and with friends and there's so much you can do with this game with boss fights, areas to explore, and crafting! Def recommend!

171805287.review: In the beginning, without knowing anything about to the game, it may seem boring and somewhat dull, just like it was for me. But it turned out I was very wrong thinking in such way, after I got slightly further into the game, which had me devoured fully. The way progression works in Terraria is such a satisfying process to go through, even if sometimes, it my get a bit grindy, be it the bosses or or looting tons of materials. Hours of non-stop playing were spent on it, and I fully admit that it was worth it! In addition to that, I hope that new players of the game, that have never seen it before won't stop after an hour of first time gameplay, because the seemingly boring beginning will eventually turn out into a very fun, long and entertaining journey, full of various emotions on the way. It is a perfect example of "not judging a book by its cover," at least for my personal experience.

170284771.review: Slap ma ass and call me Sharon, oh ma gawd, what a bootyful 'sperience this here piece of art brangs. Better'n moonshine, better'n ma cousin Carol in bed, better'n ma own Ma and Pa. Bring yer buddies/cousins/siblings/lovers/or all of 'em at once and have a bigger time than back in '79 at Forest Hill, Alabama. Us hillbillies 'preciate such fine things that show our lovely lifestyle, like the hot gal in town what only wears plants and leaves (ma cousin Sally), the medicine man who prolly cures yer ouchies with alcohol (ma grampy Jebediah, god bless his soul), and 'course that ugly, stinky sewer rat who fiddles with yer guns and makes 'em better or worse dependin' on how his sissy heart feels that moment (ma brother Gerald, now works at NASA... the moon landin' was fake and that’s why we kill the moonlord (Jeff Beysoss)). Me and ma family/lovers vote fer Trump, and we make Terraria great agin! Birds ain't real, brotha...

171358355.review: This was indeed, not 2-D Minecraft. Which is what makes it good

169900485.review: Terraria: The only game where you can go from chopping trees and building a cozy cabin to summoning giant, eldritch horrors in your backyard. It’s like Minecraft, but with way more insanity. You’ll start with a copper pickaxe and end up wielding a sword that shoots cats. Digging tunnels for hours is a thing, only to realize you’ve created a monster-infested maze. And just when you’re feeling safe, a blood moon rises and your cute little house becomes a zombie nightclub. Pro tip: the guide may seem helpful, but he’s probably giggling while you accidentally summon a giant floating eyeball that wants to eat your face. Play with friends to share the laughs, screams, and endless ‘did you just see that?!’ moments. It’s an unpredictable, hilarious adventure from start to finish!

171092732.review:
Terraria is an absolute gem in the world of sandbox games, offering an expansive and richly detailed universe that continually surprises and delights. From the moment you step into this pixelated realm, you're greeted with a vibrant world brimming with life, danger, and endless possibilities. The game's aesthetic, reminiscent of classic 2D platformers, is charmingly retro yet packed with an incredible depth of detail and creativity.

One of Terraria's most remarkable features is its vast and varied environments, each teeming with unique flora, fauna, and treasures. As players dig, fight, explore, and build, they encounter a plethora of biomes, from the verdant Forest to the eerie Crimson and the shimmering Underground Hallow. Each area presents its own challenges and rewards, encouraging exploration and discovery.

The game's progression system is both rewarding and addictive. Starting with rudimentary tools, players gradually collect resources to craft increasingly powerful weapons, armor, and accessories, allowing them to tackle tougher enemies and bosses. The sense of accomplishment from conquering these formidable foes is immense, and the thrill of unlocking new content keeps the experience fresh and exciting.

Moreover, Terraria boasts a vibrant community and a wealth of mods, which add even more layers of customization and replayability. Whether playing solo or with friends, Terraria offers an endlessly enjoyable experience that marries creativity with challenge. It's a game that truly stands the test of time, continually captivating and inspiring its players.

170853634.review:
I've played this game in almost every single way including things like the 3ds, which probably brings my playtime up into the thousands especially if I include tmodloader
And even still I'm finding new ways to enjoy the game
Like seriously, the biggest thing they didn't keep their promise on was that they weren't going to update the game anymore, and the biggest outrage was about torch luck, which not only did they remove getting negative luck from it, it also got turned into a whole endurance mini boss who dropped an item that allowed you to convert said torches into the biome specific ones for the luck they provided

in the end, the only reason to hate on this game is the fact that they're finally (probably) going to stop updating it when 1.4.5 comes out.

170466003.review: I recently dove back into Terraria, and I must say, it’s still as captivating as ever. This 2D sandbox adventure by Re-Logic offers an incredible blend of exploration, crafting, building, and combat that keeps me coming back for more. From the moment you start, armed with just a few basic tools, you're thrust into a vast, procedurally generated world that begs to be explored. Each playthrough feels unique, with diverse biomes ranging from lush forests and arid deserts to dark dungeons and hellish underworlds, each with their own adventures and challenges. Highly recommend

HOW TO GET ZENITH
1. get copper short sword
2. get starfury (from sky islands)
3. get a enchanted sword (from sword shrines or titanium and gold crates)
4.get bee keeper sword (from defeating queen bee and a 33.33% chance of getting Bee keeper)
5.get terra blade made (from true excalibur and true nights edge) also made in a Mythril anvil or Orichalcum Anvil
the true exalibur is made from 24 chlorofite bars and excalibur
the true nights edge is made from nights edge, soul of might, soul of sight and soul of fright 
6. get seedler (a 11.11% drop from plantera
7.get The Horsemas's Blade (a 1.79-14.29% drop from Pumpking boss)
8.get the influx waver (from a martian saucer)
9. get the Star wraith (from defeating moon lord 22.22% chance of dropping)
10. get meowmere (from defeating moon lord 22.22% chance of dropping)
11. get all the swords than use a Mythil anvil or a Orichalcum anvil

170726963.review:
I first got Terraria on an iPhone 4 back in 2013, when it broke I switched to Android and Terraria was the first thing I bought on the google play store. 
When I got my own laptop for the first time one of the first things I did was make a team account just so i could get Terraria. 
My steam has been hacked twice and I forgot the password once and every time when I made new accounts the first thing I did was repurchase Terraria. 
I've spent almost 1000 hours in terraria across various platforms over the past 11 years and I still discover something new every time I start a new world. 
I've bought this game 6 times over the years and it cost me less than half the price of most modern games. I can't recommend this game enough.
Stop reading reviews and just buy it already

167831588.review:
Terraria is the best game in its genre. Don't believe me? Now I will PROVE it to you.
1. You become more reserved and patient. After all, when you lose to Moonlord for the tenth time, you really want to drill a hole in the monitor, don’t you? However, after a couple of worlds in the master mode, you begin to understand reality and accept this harsh life as it is.
2. You begin to better navigate Wikipedia, because remembering recipes for more than FIVE THOUSAND is not so easy, right? But in addition to items, you will have to look for how to summon bosses, how to kill them, how to move NPCs into your home, how to buy the pylon you need, how to repay a loan, how to get a girlfriend, how to support your family with your last cents.... oh, That's not what I was talking about.
3. You don't need a high resolution monitor. Pixel games are cool.
4. Do you really need any more reasons to download this masterpiece game?

I'll be honest, for the first ten hours of the game you will be plagued by paranoia and increased temper. It will pass soon, don't worry. After the rehabilitation period in a mental hospital, you will feel that same feeling of peace and tranquility.

10/10 Broken Zeniths

P. S. I hope the translator translated this text correctly.

167141366.review:
I am a 54 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you were supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he helped me. Loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories
Thank you <3

169644677.review:
Graphics and Art Style: 9/10
While Terraria uses a pixel art style that is somewhat retro, its unique and charming art style is notable. The various environments, enemies, and item designs are rich and diverse, with every detail reflecting the developers' dedication. Although it lacks the high resolution 3D graphics of modern games, its 2D pixel art style successfully creates a distinctive atmosphere.

Gameplay: 10/10
The core gameplay of Terraria includes exploration, building, combat, and survival. Players can freely explore the world, collect resources to craft weapons and armor, and fight various enemies and bosses. The game's mechanics are deep and complex, providing players with continuous fun and challenges.

Content Depth: 10/10
Terraria boasts extremely rich content, including a large number of items, weapons, armor, NPCs, enemies, and bosses. The exploration and adventure within the game are virtually endless, with various hidden secrets and events that constantly offer new content for players to discover. The game's updates and the creative workshop add even more content and playability.

Sound and Music: 9/10
The game's music and sound effects are very fitting for its overall atmosphere. Each different environment has unique background music, greatly enhancing the game's immersion. While the sound effects and music may not be particularly outstanding, they are an important part of the gaming experience.

Social and Multiplayer Mode: 10/10
Terraria supports multiplayer mode. Players can explore, build, and fight together with friends, experiencing the joy of cooperation. The multiplayer mode increases the game's interactivity and fun, making it an excellent game to play with friends.

Overall, Terraria is an excellent sandbox game with a high degree of freedom and rich content. Whether in single player or multiplayer mode, players can find enjoyment in this vast world. With its rich content and deep gameplay, it successfully stands out among many sandbox games. The game performs exceptionally well in all aspects, making it a game worth investing in for the long term.

166441555.review:
If you want a fun game, this is it.
If you want a unique game, this is it.
If you want a game you can come back to and play again and again, this is it.

Does it have it's quirks? Of course, but what great game doesnt?
Either way, this is a game is a must if you just want to have a good time.
